Package plotting

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • plotting.Graph

  • public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object

    Graph.java
    Renders graphs using the Java 2D API

    All customizable settings are defined in PlotSettings.java

    This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; provided that any use properly credits the author. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details at http://www.gnu.org

    Author:
    Olly Oechsle

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Color> functionColors
      colors to plot the functions
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> functionNames
      the names of the functions, to be printed in the top right corner, using the appropriate color
      java.util.ArrayList<Plotter> functions
      A graph may plot as many functions as it wants These may all be of different types.
      PlotSettings plotSettings  
      static java.lang.String VERSION  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Graph​(PlotSettings p)
      Initialises the graph with the plot settings to use.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addFunctionPlotter​(Plotter f, java.lang.String name)
      adds a function to the printing list, and also adds a new color to print this function with if there a already a number of functions exceeding the limit set in PlotSettings, the oldes one will be erased, and so will its color
      void draw​(java.awt.Graphics g, int width, int height)
      Draws the graph using a graphics object.
      void drawLine​(java.awt.Graphics g, double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      Plots a line between two sets of values.
      void drawRectangle​(java.awt.Graphics g, double x1, double x2, double y1, double y2)
      used to plot Interval valued functions
      double getActualHeight​(double height)
      Takes a numeric distance and calculates how many actual pixels high that is.
      double getActualWidth​(double width)
      Takes a numeric distance and calculates how many actual pixels wide that is.
      double getActualX​(int pixelX)  
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage​(int width, int height)
      Returns the graph as an image so that it can be saved.
      double getPlotHeight​(double height)
      Takes a set number of actual pixels on the screen (in the Y direction) And returns how long they are, if plotted on the graph.
      double getPlotWidth​(double width)
      Takes a set number of actual pixels on the screen (in the X direction) And returns how long they are, if plotted on the graph.
      int getPlotX​(double x)
      Uses the numeric value of X, and figures out which pixel on the screen this relates to.
      int getPlotY​(double y)
      Uses the numeric value of Y (as returned by a function) and figures out which pixel on screen this relates to.

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine​(java.awt.Graphics g,
                     double x1,
                     double y1,
                     double x2,
                     double y2)
        Plots a line between two sets of values.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context upon which to write
        x1 - First point X
        y1 - First point Y
        x2 - Second point X
        y2 - Second point Y

      • drawRectangle

        public void drawRectangle​(java.awt.Graphics g,
                          double x1,
                          double x2,
                          double y1,
                          double y2)
        used to plot Interval valued functions
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context upon which to write
        x1 - x-coordinate of the bottom left corner
        x2 - x-coordinate of the top right corner
        y1 - y-coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y2 - y-coordinate of the top right corner
